intro: Psychotria subspathacea, commonly known as the "Cape Verde psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and rocky soils, adapting to the arid conditions of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
